word:
It was not my work when at Preston that had that effect on her which caused her to be nervously prostrated. It was her lovesick sentimentalism 


                                    -273- 

for a man in America, who has given up the truth. She expected he would write her, renewing his attentions to her, but no letter was received, and she almost blasphemed God because of His providence. She would ask, "Why does God permit these things to be?" in such a spirit of vehemence and rebellion that I was frightened.
